translated: Borglund, Erland Fredrik, principal. Dals Långed, born on August 6, 1894 in Gothenburg, son of Svante Ad. B. and Anna Andersson. Married in 1934 to Elsa Naemi Fogel. Completed elementary school education at Gothenburg’s elementary school seminar in 1916, with several continuing education courses. Studied vocational training for private workwear with scholarships from the Board of Trustees in Denmark, Germany, and Switzerland in 1937. Traveled to France in 1937 and visited Norway, Finland, and Denmark several times. Worked as a substitute teacher in Torsered's elementary school in 1916, taught at the elementary school in Stenkyrka from 1917 until 1919, and in Stene-by from 1920 until 1945. Founder of the Steneby home association from 1929, principal of the Steneby vocational school from 1935, and consultant for the Swedish home association’s national association from 1947. Member of the national association for home handicrafts and the Swedish home handicraft association in 1944, the JUF’s handicraft committee in 1945, and chairman of the board of the ice-skating promotion association’s outdoor center at Laxsjön in 1945. Member of the association for employment and occupational therapy in Sweden in 1945. Wrote the following books: "Steneby 10 years, home handicrafts association, and vocational school searching for a solution to social problems" (1939), "Small handicrafts" (1939), "Occupational therapy in hospitals and care facilities" (1944), and "Handbook in basket weaving" (1947). Lectured on pedagogical and home handicraft issues in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Denmark. Founded the Steneby industrial and handicraft association in 1937. Received a Swedish home décor diploma at the 100-year anniversary of the Swedish elementary school in 1942.
